title: Andy Robertson elbowed Ayoze Perez to spark fight after late Liverpool win
text:
Footage showed Andy Robertson giving a sly elbow to Ayoze Perez (Optus Sport)

Andy Robertson elbowed Ayoze Perez to spark their fight after Liverpool’s late win over Leicester City on Saturday.

James Milner’s penalty in injury time sealed a 2-1 victory for Jurgen Klopp’s side after James Maddison’s equaliser in the 80th minute had cancelled out Sadio Mane’s first-half opener.

But moments after the full-time whistle, Robertson and Perez clashed as the Leicester forward pushed the Liverpool defender in the back.

Players from both sides became involved in a brawl, while the heated exchange continued in the tunnel as they left the pitch.

But subsequent television footage from Optus Sport has revealed that Robertson delivered a sly elbow to Perez’s midriff, which prompted the push from the Leicester player.

This is what exactly happened between Robertson and Perez. What an idiot from Perez to start this over nothing. pic.twitter.com/M1MRraBYNQ — Sam (@SamueILFC) October 6, 2019

Speaking after the game, Leicester manager Brendan Rodgers admitted Perez was unhappy with Robertson’s decision to celebrate in front of him, but made no reference to the elbow from the Liverpool defender.

‘According to the guys, Andy Robertson, on the final whistle, celebrated and pushed him, which he probably didn’t expect,’ said Rodgers.

‘He was annoyed at that. It led to a melee but it was nothing.’
